Qualifiers.title: 2nd floor equivalency counting
Qualifiers.scope: Counting of gross floor area (GFA) attributable to vertical volumes above the 1st-floor finished floor (spaces open to below, vaulted spaces, inaccessible attics, stairwells measured as vaulted).
applicability: Applies to portions of building volumes that are higher than 17 ft above the top of finished floor (TFF) of the 1st floor.
Applies only to space/volume that does not already count as floor area.
Applies regardless of the floor plan configuration or usage of the space.
exclusions: Any area already counted as floor area (no double counting).
ambiguous_language: “Areas higher than 17' above the first floor” — unclear whether height is measured to the underside of roof/ceiling, top of roof material, or another datum. Figure callouts suggest TFF-to-roof/ceiling, but this should be confirmed.
“Do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces” — e.g. indicates examples; the full set of qualifying spaces is not enumerated.
“Width of area that counts ...” — precise horizontal projection method and edge limits are not explicitly defined in text.

height_above_first_floor_ft.description: Vertical distance from the 1st-floor TFF to the overhead surface defining the volume (roof/ceiling/structure).

counts_as_floor_area_already.description: Whether the area is already included in floor area calculations.

plan_projected_area_over_17ft_sf.description: Horizontal plan-projected area of space where height_above_first_floor_ft > 17 ft.

space_category.description: Space type for context. Allowed: open_atrium, inaccessible_attic, vaulted_ceiling, stairwell, other.

second_floor_equivalency_height_threshol.spec: Threshold elevation above 1st-floor TFF that triggers 2nd-floor equivalency counting.

first_floor_reference_surface.value: Top of finished floor (TFF) of 1st floor

then.notes: Counts in addition to the 1st-floor area beneath.
Counting is independent of floor plan or usage of the space.

Relationships.details: Stairwells are measured the same way as vaulted ceiling spaces for equivalency purposes.
Relationships.depends_on: Rule: Stairwells measured as vaulted spaces

Relationships.details: 2nd-floor equivalency may stack with 3rd-floor equivalency where the same plan area exceeds both thresholds.
Figure 12 illustrates Area B (1st + 2nd floor equivalency) and baseline widths.

Qualifiers.title: 3rd floor equivalency counting
Qualifiers.scope: Counting of additional gross floor area (GFA) for vertical volumes that exceed a higher threshold above the 1st-floor finished floor.
applicability: Applies to portions of building volumes that are higher than 26 ft above the 1st-floor TFF.
Applies only to space/volume that does not already count as floor area.
Applies regardless of the floor plan configuration or usage of the space.
exclusions: Any area already counted as floor area (no double counting).
ambiguous_language: Same ambiguities regarding reference datum and projection limits as for the 17 ft threshold.
Implicit stacking with 2nd-floor equivalency is inferred from examples; text implies additive counting but does not explicitly state procedural order.

height_above_first_floor_ft.description: Vertical distance from the 1st-floor TFF to the overhead surface defining the volume (roof/ceiling/structure).

counts_as_floor_area_already.description: Whether the area is already included in floor area calculations.

plan_projected_area_over_26ft_sf.description: Horizontal plan-projected area of space where height_above_first_floor_ft > 26 ft.

third_floor_equivalency_height_threshold.spec: Threshold elevation above 1st-floor TFF that triggers 3rd-floor equivalency counting.

first_floor_reference_surface.value: Top of finished floor (TFF) of 1st floor

then.notes: Counts in addition to the same area’s 1st-floor and 2nd-floor equivalency counts.

Exceptions.details: Up to 200 sf of 3rd-floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper.
Exceptions.conditions_reference: See Exemption rule for steep roofs
Exceptions.ambiguous_language: “May be exempted” implies discretionary approval; administrative process not detailed.

Relationships.details: 3rd-floor equivalency is additive with 2nd-floor equivalency where the same footprint exceeds both 17 ft and 26 ft.

Relationships.depends_on: Rule: Stairwells measured as vaulted spaces

Relationships.details: Figure 12 illustrates Area A (1st + 2nd + 3rd floor equivalency).

Qualifiers.title: Stairwells measured as vaulted ceiling spaces
Qualifiers.scope: Measurement method equivalence for determining 2nd/3rd floor equivalency areas.
applicability: Applies to stairwells wherever they contribute to height-above-1st-floor volumes.
ambiguous_language: Extent of stairwell shaft to be included (e.g., above landing enclosures, under intermediate landings) is not specified; treat the stairwell void consistently with how vaulted ceiling volume is delineated.

stairwell_void_area_sf.description: Plan-projected area of the stairwell void relevant to equivalency calculation.

height_above_first_floor_ft.description: Vertical distance from the 1st-floor TFF to the overhead surface within/over the stairwell.

measurement_method.spec: Use the same rules for defining plan-projected area over height thresholds.

then.details: When evaluating stairwells for equivalency, use the vaulted ceiling measurement approach for thresholds at 17 ft and 26 ft.

Relationships.details: This measurement method applies to both 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency rules.

Qualifiers.title: Exemption for 3rd floor equivalency with steep roofs
Qualifiers.scope: Optional reduction of 3rd-floor equivalency area from GFA when a minimum roof pitch is met.
applicability: Applies only to the portion of area counted as 3rd-floor equivalency.
Applies only where the building’s roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper.
exclusions: Does not apply when roof pitch is shallower than 4:12.
ambiguous_language: “May be exempted” implies discretionary approval or application by right not specified.
Scope of application (per building vs per lot vs per roof segment) is not explicit; assumed to be per building unless clarified in the Height section.
Treatment of multiple discrete 3rd-floor equivalency areas relative to the 200 sf cap is not specified; assumed total combined cap of 200 sf.

roof_pitch_rise_run.description: Roof pitch expressed as inches of rise per 12 inches of run (e.g., 4:12).

third_floor_equivalency_area_total_sf.description: Total area counted as 3rd-floor equivalency before exemption.

exemption_area_requested_sf.description: Area of 3rd-floor equivalency the applicant seeks to exempt.

roof_pitch_threshold_rise_run.spec: Minimum roof pitch required to qualify for the exemption.

roof_pitch_threshold_decimal_slope.spec: Decimal slope equivalent of 4:12 for computational use (approximate).

third_floor_equivalency_exemption_cap_sf.spec: Maximum 3rd-floor equivalency area that may be exempted.

if.interpretation: Compare as slope; 4:12 or steeper qualifies.

then.notes: Exempted amount is subtracted from GFA.

Exceptions.details: If roof pitch is less than 4:12, no 3rd-floor equivalency exemption is allowed.

Relationships.details: Modifies the outcome of the 3rd-floor equivalency counting by reducing up to 200 sf from GFA.
See “Height” section for additional definitions/procedures related to roof pitch.
